item.title: Raise Animals Codes (October 2025)
item.content:encoded:
Redeem these Roblox Raise Animals monthly codes for October 2025 to get your hands on loads of free Coral, Gems, and Cash. Use these resources to unlock more Lasso Spins, thereby boosting your chance to acquire some Legendary or Rainbow-level animals.

Increasing your zoo’s value in Roblox Raise Animals is a true grind. Players must travel through various maps, tame different animals, and showcase them in their zoos to earn large amounts of Money. However, catching the rarest animals requires the best Lassos. Instead of spending Robux on Rubies, Money, and other resources, you can simply redeem the active Raise Animals codes to get them for free.

New players will benefit the most, as these rewards let them stock up on rare Food and Animals early on, speeding up their zoo’s growth without the hardcore grinding.

Active Raise Animals codes

  • FreeCorals – Coral and Gems (New)
    SorryForAllTheBugs –  Coral and Gems (New)
  • Ocean – Cash, Gems, and Coral 
  • Update1 –  Coral and Gems 
  • 50MVisitsTysm – Gems 

Inactive Raise Animals codes

  • SryForTheGamepassIssue
  • 10MVisitsTysm
  • 10KActiveTysm
  • Release!
  • FREE RANDOM ANIMALS
  • 5MVisitsTysm
  • 1MVisitsTysm
  • SorryForBugs
  • 3KActiveTysm
  • SorryForAllTheBugs

How To Redeem Raise Animals Codes

You must have liked Raise Animals and should be part of the game’s official Roblox group to redeem codes. Just go to the game’s homepage and scroll down to find the thumbs-up icon. Select the developer’s name to open the group interface and choose the “Join Community” button to do the same. Hence, join the group pronto and start redeeming the codes before they expire. 

Follow these steps to redeem all the active codes: 

  1. Launch the game and get into the server. 
  2. Choose the settings logo on the top right corner of the screen. 
  3. Scroll down to the last to access the code box. 
  4. Enter the code in the “Code Here…” text box. 
  5. Hit the “REDEEM” button to activate the code. 

More About Raise Animals Codes

Invest the free Money into purchasing Animals and Food. The following Animals are available in the shop: 

  • Snake – Basic
  • Buffalo – Basic
  • Fish – Basic
  • Ostrich – Basic
  • Zebra – Basic
  • Moose – Rare
  • Yak- Rare
  • Seal – Rare
  • Jellyfish – Rare
  • Toucan – Rare
  • Tiger – Epic
  • Penguin – Epic
  • Elephant – Epic
  • Crab – Epic
  • Giraffe – Epic
  • Turtle – Epic
  • Walrus – Epic
  • Gorilla – Legendary
  • Shark – Legendary
  • Whale – Legendary
  • Crocodile – Legendary
  • Polar Bear – Legendary
  • Orca – Rainbow 
  • Lion – Rainbow
  • Narvhal – Rainbow

One Lasso spin costs 50 Rubies, and ten cost 500. You can easily acquire the Legendary and Rainbow Lassos without breaking a sweat. 

Where To Find New Raise Animals Codes?

The latest codes can be found on the game’s official Discord server. To stay updated with the release of codes, you should keep track of our active codes list, as they’ll be updated whenever fresh codes drop.

Having fun using codes in Roblox games? Then check out the latest codes for 99 Nights in the Forest, Type Soul, and Azure Latch. Also, check out the Insider Gaming Discord server.

item.title: Effortless Tower Codes (October 2025)
item.content:encoded:
Use these Effortless Tower monthly codes for October 2025 in Roblox to gain some much-needed Skips in the game, allowing you to ease past the levels that you get stuck at. 

Effortless Tower is one of the many obby (obstacle course) games in Roblox, where players are tasked with simply getting from one point to another without hitting any of the obstacles in the way. Although many obby games on Roblox tend to be quite challenging, Effortless Tower offers a more enjoyable difficulty, making it a better option for players looking simply for a fun experience. There are over 5000 levels in Effortless Tower, each offering a different kind of challenge. Some, however, can be too difficult to surpass for some players, and this is where the Skips that can be acquired through codes come into the picture. 

Players progress through the levels by simply moving around, jumping, and climbing, and each level is harder than the previous one. The game also offers players the option to teleport to the previous checkpoint with just a single clip, making it a very beginner-friendly gameplay experience. 

Active Effortless Tower Codes 

  • BYEMILITARY: 1 Skip (NEW)
  • SAVESKIP: 1 Skip (NEW)
  • THANKYOU: 1 Skip
  • SUMMER: 1 Skip

Expired Effortless Tower Codes

As of the writing of this article, there are no expired codes in Effortless Tower. Players are encouraged to make the most of this opportunity by redeeming the available codes quickly, as they can expire at any time. Once they do expire, they will be moved into the expired codes section. 

How To Redeem Effortless Tower Codes

Redeeming codes on Effortless Tower is a fairly straightforward process, requiring no additional steps. It’s as simple as navigating through the menus and inputting one of the active codes given above into the right text box. As simple as that sounds, newer players might find it challenging to find the codes section in the game. Here’s a step-by-step guide to make it easier for them:

  1. Launch Roblox and open up Effortless Tower.
  2. Click on the ‘Code’ button at the top of the screen.
  3. Input one of the active codes given above into the text box.
  4. Click on the confirm button to claim your rewards.

How To Get More Effortless Tower Codes

As is the case with most Roblox games, codes are often released through the game’s social media pages or its official Discord server. Tracking these on a regular basis, though, can be a hassle, and that’s where this page can be your savior. By simply bookmarking this page, you can stay up to date with the latest codes, as we update this article as soon as any new codes drop. The developers release new codes mostly during events or updates, so expect that trend to continue for Effortless Tower as well.

Enjoying our Roblox games codes coverage? Check out the codes for popular games like Steal A Brainrot, Radiant Residents, and Fix It Up on Insider Gaming!

Interested in the latest developments in the world of gaming and esports? Then join the Insider Gaming Discord server and engage with the passionate community.

item.title: Bayonetta Director Feels ‘Unique Experiences’ Matter More than Graphics
item.content:encoded:
The creator of Bayonetta, Devil May Cry, and more feels that unique gameplay mechanics are more important than graphics in action games.

During a new interview with Famitsu (via Automaton), Bayonetta creator Hideki Kamiya discussed the progress 3D action games have made lately and what he feels is most important in the genre for players and developers. Kamiya has been at the forefront of action games for a very long time and has delivered some of the biggest games in the genre.

Hideki Kamiya Wants to See Unique Experiences Which “Only That One Game Can Offer”

Kamiya first spoke about how he approaches new games, revealing that he will work on creating “a unique gameplay mechanic that can only be experienced in that game.” He elaborated with examples of systems he developed for games like Bayonetta and Okami. Bayonetta had a Witch Time system that slowed time whenever the player dodged an enemy’s attack. Okami has the Celestial Brush system, which lets players “directly affect the game world by drawing.”

The Bayonetta creator explained that as a player, he wants to “get excited by the unique experiences which only that one game can offer”, rather than improved graphics. Kamiya then praised how far 3D action games have come. He first spoke about how there weren’t many 3D action games for some years, but recently there has been a surge in “a lot of stylish, combo-based action titles.” He concluded, stating, “It’s amazing to me that someone can just start making a game and end up with something of that quality.” 

In other news, Devil May Cry 5 hit a new sales milestone thanks to the Netflix adaptation. Additionally, Hideki Kamiya wants to remake the original DMC game. What are your thoughts on Hideki Kamiya wanting unique gameplay mechanics over pretty graphics? Let us know through the official Insider Gaming Discord.

For more information from Insider Gaming, read about Steam’s new Personal Calendar feature, which helps players discover the latest and upcoming titles. Don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.

item.title: Steam’s New Personal Calendar Feature Helps You Discover New Games
item.content:encoded:
Steam’s Personal Calendar will help players discover new and upcoming games through a schedule of upcoming releases and personalized recommendations.

Personal Calendar is a store feature that will be available as a Steam Labs experiment. This will allow the company to gather feedback and make more improvements to this tool. It will show players not just recently released games but also upcoming games, and it has been filtered down to a collection that Steam believes the player is most likely to be interested in.

How Does Steam’s Personal Calendar Work?

Explained in a new blog post, this new Steam tool will find players with similar playtime to the user and then look at the games they have been adding to their wishlists. The system will also look at the games the player plays the most (relative to other players) and spend most of their playtime in. Which means that the games and demos players put in for a few minutes won’t be recorded; only those they sink their teeth into will matter.

Steam’s Personal Calendar system will be retrained daily to incorporate the latest data. It has a new calendar view that lists soon-to-release titles, filters them to the set we recommend most for you, and maps them across time so you can see them at a glance. This view will also include the player’s wishlisted games. However, the Calendar is weekdays-only, since very few games are released on weekends, and they needed as much space as possible to show upcoming games.

There are some customisation controls, including the ability to filter by tag and adjust the number of results. Also, the page will filter games based on your store content preferences, such as Early Access titles, ignored products, ignored tags, and the general level of mature content.

In other news, Legendary GTA competitor ‘Scarface‘ is coming to Steam with HD Graphics Mode. Additionally, ARC Raiders recently became Steam’s most popular extraction shooter. What are your thoughts on the new Steam Personal Calendar? Let us know through the official Insider Gaming Discord.

For more information from Insider Gaming, read about Elden Ring: Tarnished Edition being delayed to 2026. Don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.

SUBSCRIBE to our newsletter to receive the latest news and exclusive leaks every week! No Spam.

item.title: Elden Ring: Tarnished Edition Delayed to 2026
item.content:encoded:
A new announcement confirmed that Elden Ring: Tarnished Edition will no longer release for the Nintendo Switch 2 in 2025 and has been delayed to 2026.

Elden Ring: Tarnished Edition’s development has been struggling slightly on Nintendo Switch 2, with the recent Gamescom 2025 demo not doing it many favours, as players pointed out substantial framerate drops. It seems that’s why the developers want to take more time before they deliver the final product.

Elden Ring: Tarnished Edition Release Pushed to 2026, Date Still Unconfirmed

The announcement about the delay comes through a post on the official Elden Ring X account (formerly Twitter). The post states that development for the Elden Ring Tarnished Edition is moving “wholeheartedly toward release”; however, they have decided to delay the launch to 2026 to allow time for performance adjustments.” The developers have apologized to the players for the delay and thanked them for their patience and support.

Overall, it’s a sound decision to delay the launch of the Elden Ring: Tarnished edition, as the game was genuinely suffering from very real performance issues. Players have reported framerates dropping to as low as 15 fps, while doing “the most simple stuff,” and when players “get to the outside world, and the framerate just tanks.” The added time will help developers to work towards optimisation and provide a more solid build for release.

In other news, Alex Garland wrote 160 pages to pitch the Elden Ring movie. Additionally, Nightreign and Shadow of the Erdtree hit new sales milestones earlier this year. What are your thoughts on Elden Ring Tarnished Edition being delayed to 2026? Let us know through the official Insider Gaming Discord.

For more information from Insider Gaming, read about Battlefield 6 developers testing progression in PvE and curated community servers. Don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.
